page.title: 03Farming in rural Sowerby
page.content: {Cereals} {Wheat}_ very few samples grown this year 1985 are suitable for milling (flour) due to a very wet and cool summer. Most wheat will be used for stock feed. {Barley}_ 80% grown in this area will be used for home milling or stock feed _ barley beef. Approx. 20% is sold for malting. {Maize & Oats}_ very small acreage {Oil seed rape}_ A "break" crop instead of clover leys _ oil for cooking oils. {Yields per acre}wheat 3 tonnes,barley 2.3 tonnes, oats 2 tonnes. {Roots}_{potatoes}15 tonnes/acre Approx 1/2 crop "contracted" to make potato chips or crisps and dried pot. {Sugar beet}14-16 tonnes/acre delivered by road to York_ British Sugar Corporation.
